definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Then, the wave catches the surfboard and pulls it and the surfer toward the shore.
sentences.chinese: 接著大浪會湧向滑板，將滑板與衝浪者推往海岸。

sentences.english: Surfers look for a good spot at Bondi Beach.
sentences.chinese: 衝浪者尋找在邦迪海灘一個好的地點。

sentences.english: Attempting to force the shark to release him, the surfer slugged it on the snout over and over.
sentences.chinese: 衝浪者不斷重擊它的鼻子，試圖讓白鯊放開他。

sentences.english: Typically, people surf the Web by clicking on links to get more information.
sentences.chinese: 通常，網上衝浪者通過單擊鏈接來獲取更多的信息。

sentences.english: There are numerous legends and stories about courageous local surfers.
sentences.chinese: 有很多關於勇敢的當地衝浪者的傳說和故事。

sentences.english: The island is called Ada Bojana, and the area is quickly becoming a party destination for the young surfer set.
sentences.chinese: 現在這個海島在年輕衝浪者中迅速走熱。

sentences.english: Surfers on main beach, heading out.
sentences.chinese: 沙灘上正準備出發的衝浪者。

sentences.english: Yet, some live for interacting with its unpredictable motions; they are surfers.
sentences.chinese: 衝浪者就是同海洋不可預知的運動進行交互。

sentences.english: The surfer surfed in the sea yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 衝浪者昨天在海里衝浪。
